title: Caretaker (Part 1)
synopsis: Captain Janeway and her crew pursue a Maquis ship into the Badlands, only to find themselves transported to the Delta Quadrant by a powerful alien entity known as the Caretaker.

title: Caretaker (Part 2)
synopsis: Voyager's crew works together with the Maquis to find a way back to the Alpha Quadrant while facing the dangers of the Delta Quadrant.

title: Parallax
synopsis: Voyager becomes trapped in a quantum singularity, and the crew must work together to find a way out while dealing with internal conflicts.

title: Time and Again
synopsis: Janeway and Paris are transported back in time to a planet that is about to be destroyed, and they must prevent the disaster without altering the timeline.

title: Phage
synopsis: Neelix's lungs are stolen by an alien race known as the Vidiians, forcing the crew to find a way to save his life.

title: The Cloud
synopsis: Voyager becomes trapped in a mysterious nebula that turns out to be a living organism, and the crew must find a way to escape without harming it.

title: Eye of the Needle
synopsis: The crew discovers a micro-wormhole that leads to the Alpha Quadrant, but it connects to a time period before their disappearance.

title: Ex Post Facto
synopsis: Paris is accused of murder on an alien world and sentenced to relive the crime from the victim's perspective every 14 hours.

title: Emanations
synopsis: Voyager encounters a new element that leads to an alien afterlife, forcing Kim to experience the process of death and resurrection.

title: Prime Factors
synopsis: The crew encounters a hospitable race that possesses technology capable of sending them home, but the aliens refuse to share it due to cultural reasons.

title: State of Flux
synopsis: Seska is revealed as a Cardassian spy working with the Kazon, betraying the crew in a bid to gain power.

title: Heroes and Demons
synopsis: The Doctor experiences his first away mission when he must enter a holodeck program based on the Beowulf epic to save crew members trapped by an energy being.

title: Cathexis
synopsis: An alien entity possesses members of the crew, leading to mistrust and paranoia as they try to discover the intruder's identity.

title: Faces
synopsis: The Vidiians split B'Elanna Torres into her human and Klingon halves, leading to a personal crisis as she confronts her dual heritage.

title: Jetrel
synopsis: Neelix confronts his past when he meets Dr. Jetrel, the scientist responsible for developing a weapon that wiped out his home colony.

title: Learning Curve
synopsis: Tuvok trains a group of former Maquis members in Starfleet protocol, testing both their limits and his patience.

title: The 37's
synopsis: Voyager discovers a group of humans abducted from Earth in 1937, including Amelia Earhart, living on a distant planet.

title: Initiations
synopsis: Chakotay is captured by a young Kazon who is undergoing a ritual to become a warrior, leading to a struggle for survival.

title: Projections
synopsis: The Doctor begins to question his reality when he is told he is actually a human who has been implanted with false memories.

title: Elogium
synopsis: Kes undergoes the Ocampan mating cycle, the elogium, forcing her to decide whether to start a family with Neelix.

title: Non Sequitur
synopsis: Harry Kim wakes up in an alternate timeline where he never joined Voyager, and he must find a way to return to his reality.

title: Twisted
synopsis: Voyager becomes trapped in a spatial distortion that warps the ship's structure, causing confusion and danger.

title: Parturition
synopsis: Paris and Neelix must work together to care for an alien baby after becoming stranded on a hostile planet.

title: Persistence of Vision
synopsis: The crew begins experiencing hallucinations based on their deepest fears and desires, threatening the safety of the ship.

title: Tattoo
synopsis: Chakotay discovers a connection between his tribe's spiritual beliefs and an alien race encountered by Voyager.

title: Cold Fire
synopsis: Voyager encounters a group of Ocampa led by a powerful being who promises to help them find a way home.

title: Maneuvers
synopsis: Seska returns, leading a Kazon attack on Voyager to steal technology, forcing Chakotay to take drastic action.

title: Resistance
synopsis: Janeway is captured by an alien resistance movement while searching for supplies on a war-torn planet.

title: Prototype
synopsis: B'Elanna attempts to help a race of robots reproduce, only to discover they were built as weapons of war.

title: Alliances
synopsis: Janeway considers forming an alliance with the Kazon to ensure Voyager's survival in the Delta Quadrant.

title: Threshold
synopsis: Paris breaks the warp 10 barrier, leading to unexpected and bizarre transformations.

title: Meld
synopsis: Tuvok mind melds with a murderous crew member to understand his motives, leading to a dangerous mental struggle.

title: Dreadnought
synopsis: B'Elanna must stop a Cardassian missile with a mind of its own that she once reprogrammed when it threatens a peaceful planet.

title: Death Wish
synopsis: A member of the Q Continuum seeks asylum on Voyager, leading to a trial to determine whether he has the right to end his immortal life.

title: Lifesigns
synopsis: The Doctor falls in love with a Vidiian patient whose life he saves by transferring her consciousness into a holographic body.

title: Investigations
synopsis: Neelix becomes an investigative reporter when he suspects a traitor is on board Voyager, leading to a confrontation with the Kazon.

title: Deadlock
synopsis: Voyager is duplicated by a spatial anomaly, and the crew must sacrifice one ship to save the other.

title: Innocence
synopsis: Tuvok crash-lands on a moon and discovers a group of children who are about to die, only to learn they are actually aging in reverse.

title: The Thaw
synopsis: The crew encounters an alien culture trapped in a computer-generated nightmare world controlled by a malevolent entity.

title: Tuvix
synopsis: A transporter accident fuses Tuvok and Neelix into a single being, and Janeway must decide whether to reverse the process, knowing it will end the new life.

title: Resolutions
synopsis: Janeway and Chakotay are left behind on a planet due to an incurable virus, and the crew struggles with the decision to leave them.

title: Basics (Part 1)
synopsis: Voyager is captured by the Kazon, and the crew is marooned on a primitive planet as Seska and the Kazon take control of the ship.

title: Basics (Part 2)
synopsis: The stranded crew must survive on a hostile planet while Paris and the Doctor work to retake Voyager from the Kazon.

title: Flashback
synopsis: Tuvok experiences a flashback to his time serving under Captain Sulu, as Voyager encounters an alien race that feeds on memories.

title: The Chute
synopsis: Paris and Kim are falsely accused of a terrorist bombing and imprisoned in a brutal alien facility.

title: The Swarm
synopsis: Voyager is attacked by a mysterious alien species known as the Swarm, while the Doctor's program begins to degrade.

title: False Profits
synopsis: Voyager encounters two Ferengi who have established themselves as gods on a primitive planet, and the crew must stop their exploitation.

title: Remember
synopsis: B'Elanna experiences vivid dreams of a tragic event from an alien culture's past, forcing her to confront the truth.

title: Sacred Ground
synopsis: When Kes is injured by an alien force, Janeway undergoes a series of spiritual trials to save her life.

title: Future's End (Part 1)
synopsis: Voyager is pulled back in time to 20th-century Earth, where they must prevent a technology mogul from using 29th-century technology to alter the future.

title: Future's End (Part 2)
synopsis: Janeway and her crew must stop the temporal disruption and return to the 24th century, with the help of a 29th-century time ship.

title: Warlord
synopsis: Kes is taken over by an alien warlord who uses her body to continue his fight for control of his world.

title: The Q and the Grey
synopsis: Q returns to Voyager, seeking Janeway's help to end a civil war within the Q Continuum by offering to mate with her.

title: Macrocosm
synopsis: Voyager is infested by giant viruses, and Janeway must take on the role of an action hero to save her ship.

title: Fair Trade
synopsis: Neelix gets involved in illegal activities at a space station to obtain a map of the sector, risking his life and the safety of the crew.

title: Alter Ego
synopsis: Tuvok becomes romantically involved with a holodeck character, leading to complications when the program begins to take on a life of its own.

title: Coda
synopsis: Janeway is caught in a time loop where she repeatedly dies, forcing her to confront questions of life and death.

title: Blood Fever
synopsis: B'Elanna experiences pon farr, the Vulcan mating ritual, and must deal with her aggressive impulses.

title: Unity
synopsis: Chakotay encounters a group of ex-Borg who have formed a cooperative society, but their methods raise ethical concerns.

title: The Darkling
synopsis: The Doctor's program becomes unstable when he experiments with integrating personalities from historical figures, leading to dangerous behavior.

title: Rise
synopsis: Tuvok and Neelix must work together to save a planet from destruction by using a space elevator, despite their differences.

title: Favorite Son
synopsis: Kim discovers he may be part of an alien race and is welcomed to their planet, only to uncover a deadly secret.

title: Before and After
synopsis: Kes begins experiencing time backwards, from her death to her birth, and must find a way to reverse the process.

title: Real Life
synopsis: The Doctor creates a holographic family to experience life as a parent, but he soon learns that real life is not as perfect as he imagined.

title: Distant Origin
synopsis: An alien scientist discovers evidence that his species shares a common ancestry with humans, challenging his society's beliefs.

title: Displaced
synopsis: The crew is systematically replaced by aliens who take over Voyager, forcing the remaining crew to find a way to regain control.

title: Worst Case Scenario
synopsis: A holodeck training program designed for a Maquis mutiny becomes a real threat when Seska's hologram takes over.

title: Scorpion (Part 1)
synopsis: Voyager encounters the Borg facing a powerful new enemy, Species 8472, forcing Janeway to consider an alliance with the Borg.

title: Scorpion (Part 2)
synopsis: Voyager forms an uneasy alliance with the Borg to defeat Species 8472, but the cost may be too high.

title: The Gift
synopsis: Kes develops new powers that threaten the ship, forcing her to leave Voyager, while Seven of Nine struggles with her new humanity.

title: Day of Honor
synopsis: B'Elanna faces a series of challenges on the Klingon Day of Honor, leading to a crisis when she and Paris are stranded in space.

title: Nemesis
synopsis: Chakotay is stranded on a planet where he becomes involved in a brutal conflict, only to discover that the truth is not what it seems.

title: Revulsion
synopsis: The Doctor and Torres respond to a distress call from a holographic crew member who has gone mad and killed his organic crewmates.

title: The Raven
synopsis: Seven of Nine begins experiencing memories of her assimilation and is compelled to return to the wreckage of the Raven, the ship where she was assimilated.

title: Scientific Method
synopsis: Voyager's crew is subjected to unethical experiments by invisible aliens, leading to dangerous consequences.

title: Year of Hell (Part 1)
synopsis: Voyager faces a relentless attack from a Krenim ship with the ability to alter time, leading to devastating losses.

title: Year of Hell (Part 2)
synopsis: Janeway makes a desperate sacrifice to restore the timeline and save her crew from the Krenim's temporal weapon.

title: Random Thoughts
synopsis: B'Elanna is arrested on a planet where violent thoughts are illegal, leading to a dangerous mind probe.

title: Concerning Flight
synopsis: Janeway teams up with a holographic Leonardo da Vinci to recover stolen technology from a group of thieves.

title: Mortal Coil
synopsis: Neelix dies and is resurrected through Borg technology, leading him to question his faith and the meaning of his life.

title: Waking Moments
synopsis: The crew is trapped in a shared dream by an alien race, forcing Chakotay to use his lucid dreaming skills to free them.

title: Message in a Bottle
synopsis: The Doctor is sent to a distant part of the galaxy via a communications relay to deliver a message to Starfleet, only to find himself on a captured Starfleet ship.

title: Hunters
synopsis: Voyager begins receiving messages from the Alpha Quadrant, but the crew must deal with the threat of the Hirogen.

title: Prey
synopsis: Voyager encounters a member of Species 8472 being hunted by the Hirogen, leading to a deadly standoff.

title: Retrospect
synopsis: Seven of Nine accuses an alien arms dealer of assault, leading to a tense investigation and questions of memory and guilt.

title: The Killing Game (Part 1)
synopsis: The Hirogen take over Voyager and force the crew to participate in deadly holographic simulations, including a World War II scenario.

title: The Killing Game (Part 2)
synopsis: Janeway and the crew fight to regain control of Voyager from the Hirogen and end their deadly games.

title: Vis Ã  Vis
synopsis: Paris befriends an alien who swaps bodies with him, leading to a crisis when the alien refuses to switch back.

title: The Omega Directive
synopsis: Voyager encounters a dangerous molecule that has the potential to destroy subspace, and Janeway must decide how far to go to neutralize it.

title: Unforgettable
synopsis: Chakotay falls in love with an alien woman whose species is forgotten by everyone they meet, leading to a tragic romance.

title: Living Witness
synopsis: The Doctor's backup module is found 700 years in the future, where he must defend Voyager's legacy against a distorted historical record.

title: Demon
synopsis: Voyager lands on a 'Demon' class planet where the crew begins to duplicate, leading to unexpected consequences.

title: One
synopsis: Seven of Nine is left alone to pilot Voyager through a dangerous nebula while the rest of the crew is in stasis, testing her resolve and humanity.

title: Hope and Fear
synopsis: Voyager encounters a mysterious alien who offers them a seemingly perfect way home, but all is not as it seems.

title: Night
synopsis: Voyager travels through a vast region of space devoid of stars, leading to a crisis of morale among the crew and Janeway's guilt over stranding them in the Delta Quadrant.

title: Drone
synopsis: An accident leads to the creation of a 29th-century Borg drone, who must choose between his individuality and the Collective.

title: Extreme Risk
synopsis: B'Elanna recklessly endangers her life while building a new shuttle, forcing her to confront her suppressed emotions.

title: In the Flesh
synopsis: Voyager discovers a Species 8472 training facility that mimics Starfleet headquarters, raising fears of an invasion.

title: Once Upon a Time
synopsis: Neelix cares for Naomi Wildman while her mother is on a dangerous away mission, using a holodeck program to shield her from the truth.

title: Timeless
synopsis: Kim and Chakotay send a message back in time to prevent Voyager's destruction, altering the course of history.

title: Infinite Regress
synopsis: Seven of Nine begins experiencing multiple personalities from assimilated individuals, threatening her sanity.

title: Nothing Human
synopsis: The Doctor is forced to use the knowledge of a Cardassian war criminal to save B'Elanna's life, raising ethical questions.

title: Thirty Days
synopsis: Paris is demoted and sentenced to 30 days in the brig after defying orders to save an underwater civilization.

title: Counterpoint
synopsis: Voyager is repeatedly searched by an alien species hunting for telepaths, leading to a cat-and-mouse game of deception.

title: Latent Image
synopsis: The Doctor discovers a gap in his memory and uncovers a disturbing secret about his past decisions.

title: Bride of Chaotica!
synopsis: The crew must play out the events of a holodeck program to stop alien invaders from another dimension.

title: Gravity
synopsis: Tuvok, Paris, and the Doctor are trapped on a planet where time moves faster, leading to a struggle for survival.

title: Bliss
synopsis: Voyager encounters a 'perfect' wormhole leading to Earth, but Seven and Naomi Wildman suspect it may be too good to be true.

title: Dark Frontier (Part 1)
synopsis: Janeway plans a mission to steal a transwarp coil from the Borg, but Seven's connection to the Collective complicates the mission.

title: Dark Frontier (Part 2)
synopsis: Seven is captured by the Borg Queen, who attempts to convince her to rejoin the Collective, while Janeway plans a daring rescue.

title: The Disease
synopsis: Kim falls in love with an alien woman, leading to a conflict with Voyager's regulations and a dangerous infection.

title: Course: Oblivion
synopsis: Voyager's crew begins to disintegrate as they realize they are duplicates created by a 'Demon' class planet, leading to a race against time to preserve their existence.

title: The Fight
synopsis: Chakotay experiences hallucinations that appear to be messages from an alien species trapped in 'chaotic space,' forcing him to confront his fears.

title: Think Tank
synopsis: Voyager is pursued by bounty hunters, leading them to seek help from a group of super-intelligent beings with their own agenda.

title: Juggernaut
synopsis: Voyager encounters a Malon freighter leaking deadly radiation, and B'Elanna must lead a mission to prevent an environmental disaster.

title: Someone to Watch Over Me
synopsis: The Doctor gives Seven lessons in social interaction and romance, only to develop feelings for her himself.
Janeway reflects on her ancestor's role in building the Millennium Gate, a historical monument, and its impact on her own life.

title: Relativity
synopsis: Seven is recruited by a 29th-century Starfleet officer to stop a saboteur who is trying to destroy Voyager before it leaves space dock.

title: Warhead
synopsis: The Doctor's program is taken over by a sentient alien missile, forcing the crew to find a way to stop it before it detonates.

title: Equinox (Part 1)
synopsis: Voyager encounters another Starfleet ship, the USS Equinox, which has been surviving in the Delta Quadrant using morally questionable methods.

title: Equinox (Part 2)
synopsis: Voyager and the Equinox face off as Janeway and her crew attempt to stop the Equinox's captain from using alien life forms as fuel.

title: Survival Instinct
synopsis: Seven is reunited with three former Borg drones who were once part of her 'mini-Collective,' leading to a struggle for their individuality.

title: Barge of the Dead
synopsis: B'Elanna experiences a near-death vision of the Klingon afterlife, forcing her to confront her heritage and beliefs.

title: Tinker, Tenor, Doctor, Spy
synopsis: The Doctor's daydreams of being a heroic captain are intercepted by an alien species, leading to real-life consequences.

title: Alice
synopsis: Paris becomes obsessed with an alien shuttlecraft that appears to have a mind of its own, leading him into danger.

title: Riddles
synopsis: Tuvok loses his memory and becomes more emotionally expressive after being attacked by an alien, leading to a new friendship with Neelix.

title: Dragon's Teeth
synopsis: Voyager awakens a long-dormant alien species with advanced technology, only to discover their dark history.

title: One Small Step
synopsis: Voyager discovers the remains of an early Earth spacecraft lost in a subspace anomaly, leading to a mission to recover it.

title: The Voyager Conspiracy
synopsis: Seven begins to suspect a conspiracy aboard Voyager after analyzing too much data, leading to paranoia and tension among the crew.

title: Pathfinder
synopsis: Barclay develops a method to communicate with Voyager from Earth, but his obsession with the project puts his career in jeopardy.

title: Fair Haven
synopsis: Janeway becomes romantically involved with a holographic character in a simulated Irish village, leading to ethical dilemmas.

title: Blink of an Eye
synopsis: Voyager becomes trapped in orbit around a planet where time moves at an accelerated rate, leading to the planet's inhabitants worshiping the ship as a deity.

title: Virtuoso
synopsis: The Doctor becomes a celebrity on an alien world because of his singing, leading him to consider leaving Voyager to pursue fame.

title: Memorial
synopsis: The crew experiences traumatic memories of a war they never fought after encountering a memorial that broadcasts the experiences of its victims.

title: Tsunkatse
synopsis: Seven is forced to participate in a brutal gladiatorial combat sport, leading to a struggle for her survival.

title: Collective
synopsis: Voyager encounters a Borg cube manned only by children, leading to a mission to rescue them and integrate them into the crew.

title: Spirit Folk
synopsis: The characters in Voyager's holodeck program 'Fair Haven' become self-aware and believe the crew to be supernatural beings.

title: Ashes to Ashes
synopsis: An alien race resurrects a deceased crew member, Lindsay Ballard, who returns to Voyager, leading to complications as she tries to reintegrate.

title: Child's Play
synopsis: Voyager discovers that Icheb's parents plan to send him back to the Borg as a weapon, forcing the crew to intervene.

title: Good Shepherd
synopsis: Janeway takes three misfit crew members on a mission to help them integrate into the crew and improve their performance.

title: Live Fast and Prosper
synopsis: Voyager is impersonated by con artists who use the ship's reputation to commit crimes, leading to a mission to stop them.

title: Muse
synopsis: Torres is stranded on a pre-warp planet where a playwright uses her experiences for inspiration, leading to a reflection on the power of storytelling.

title: Fury
synopsis: Kes returns to Voyager with a vendetta, using her advanced powers to seek revenge on the crew.

title: Life Line
synopsis: The Doctor travels to the Alpha Quadrant to save his creator, Dr. Lewis Zimmerman, who is dying from a mysterious illness.

title: The Haunting of Deck Twelve
synopsis: Neelix tells a ghost story to the Borg children, involving a mysterious energy life form haunting Voyager.

title: Unimatrix Zero (Part 1)
synopsis: Seven of Nine discovers a virtual reality where Borg drones retain their individuality, leading to a rebellion against the Collective.

title: Unimatrix Zero (Part 2)
synopsis: Seven and Janeway work to liberate Borg drones from the Collective by destroying Unimatrix Zero, even as the Borg Queen seeks to stop them.

title: Imperfection
synopsis: Seven faces death when her cortical node fails, and Icheb makes a risky offer to save her life.

title: Drive
synopsis: Paris and Torres's relationship is tested when they participate in a high-stakes race in the Delta Flyer.

title: Repression
synopsis: A mysterious force causes former Maquis members aboard Voyager to revert to their old allegiances, leading to a mutiny.

title: Critical Care
synopsis: The Doctor's program is stolen and he is forced to work in a medical facility where patients are treated based on their societal value.

title: Inside Man
synopsis: A holographic version of Barclay is sent to Voyager with a plan to bring the ship home, but his motives are not what they seem.

title: Body and Soul
synopsis: The Doctor's program is forced to hide in Seven's body, leading to a humorous and awkward situation.

title: Nightingale
synopsis: Kim takes command of an alien medical ship, learning the challenges of leadership in the process.

title: Flesh and Blood (Part 1)
synopsis: Voyager encounters Hirogen holograms that have gained sentience and are rebelling against their creators, leading to a deadly confrontation.

title: Flesh and Blood (Part 2)
synopsis: The crew must stop the rogue holograms from continuing their deadly campaign against organic life, with the Doctor caught in the middle.

title: Shattered
synopsis: A temporal anomaly fractures Voyager into different time periods, and Chakotay must unite the crew to save the ship.

title: Lineage
synopsis: Torres faces her fear of passing on her Klingon heritage when she discovers she is pregnant, leading to a crisis in her relationship with Paris.

title: Repentance
synopsis: Voyager transports a group of prisoners, leading to ethical dilemmas about justice, rehabilitation, and the death penalty.

title: Prophecy
synopsis: Voyager encounters a group of Klingon pilgrims who believe Torres's unborn child is the savior of their people.

title: The Void
synopsis: Voyager is trapped in a region of space where resources are scarce, leading the crew to form alliances with other trapped ships.

title: Workforce (Part 1)
synopsis: The crew of Voyager is brainwashed and forced to work in an alien labor camp, with only a few members aware of their true identities.

title: Workforce (Part 2)
synopsis: Janeway and Chakotay must free the crew from their brainwashed state and escape the alien labor camp.

title: Human Error
synopsis: Seven struggles with her feelings for Chakotay and experiments with romance in a holodeck simulation, leading to a crisis in her identity.

title: Q2
synopsis: Q's son is sent to Voyager to learn responsibility, leading to chaos and mischief on the ship.

title: Author, Author
synopsis: The Doctor writes a holonovel that paints the crew in a negative light, leading to a dispute over the ethics of his depiction and the rights of holograms.

title: Friendship One
synopsis: Voyager is tasked with retrieving an old Earth probe that has caused devastation on an alien world, leading to a crisis of responsibility.

title: Natural Law
synopsis: Chakotay and Seven are stranded on a planet with a pre-warp civilization, leading to a moral dilemma about the Prime Directive.

title: Homestead
synopsis: Neelix finds a colony of his own people in the Delta Quadrant and must decide whether to stay with them or continue with Voyager.

title: Renaissance Man
synopsis: The Doctor is forced to impersonate members of the Voyager crew to carry out a secret mission, leading to unexpected consequences.

title: Endgame (Part 1)
synopsis: In the series finale, Admiral Janeway from the future travels back in time to bring Voyager home using advanced technology, leading to a final confrontation with the Borg.

title: Endgame (Part 2)
synopsis: Voyager's journey home reaches its climax as the crew faces the ultimate challenge against the Borg, with Admiral Janeway's future self guiding the way.
